As a former educator at Bennett College and a 2 time graduate of HBCU’s I will not let these national treasures slide out of the spotlight. That is why we must ALL #StandWithBennett pic.twitter.com/OGYZrBM1iz

The Bennett Belles at @BennettCollege occupy a unique role in our nation as it is one of only 2 all-women HBCU' As an undergraduate college Bennett produces 43% of women Ph.D.'s in STEM along with their sister @SpelmanCollege

I fought in the NC House for equal pay & am continuing to fight in the US House as Chair of the @EdLaborCmte Subcommittee on Workforce Protections. We’re working on paycheck fairness, b/c every day that passes is a day that women don’t get equal wages for equal work! #EqualPay
See my offical statement on the Paycheck Fairness Act. pic.twitter.com/5JbeEk1Wmo

Because of the pay gap, Black women lose an average of $840,000 over the course of a 40-year career. That means she will have to stay in the workforce TWENTY-THREE years longer than a man to earn the same amount. https://nwlc.org/resources/equal-pay-for-black-women/ …

When women are shortchanged our children, families, and economy are shortchanged – by $500 billion dollars a year, to be exact.  https://www.aauw.org/article/gender-pay-gap-shortchanges-women-500-billion-annually/ … #EqualPay #PaycheckFairness

Nationally, women still make 80 cents for every dollar men make & women of color are even less likely to make as much as a man working the exact same job! On average, Black women make only 63 cents for every dollar a man makes. #equalpay

Today I joined my Democratic colleagues for the reintroduction of the Paycheck Fairness Act. It’s the 10th anniversary of the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Paycheck Act by @POTUS44. Ten years later the women in my District are still only making 83 cents for each dollar a man makes pic.twitter.com/PnUxwqHGgE

Today I joined @Rosa_DeLauro @SpeakerPelosi @BobbyScott & @RepAOC for the reintroduction of the Paycheck Fairness Act.  It’s the 10th anniversary of the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Paycheck Act. But, 10 years later, women in my District are only making 83¢ for each dollar a man makes.

There is no rational excuse for low-income families, seniors, and veterans to be threatened with homelessness over an expensive, ineffective wall.
In the 12th District, we are already facing an affordable housing shortage. The loss of HUD’s rental assistance because of the #TrumpShutdown would be absolutely devastating for our community.
In North Carolina, over 135,000 low-income households rely on federal rental assistance to help ensure there is a roof over their heads and a safe place to sleep.

This reckless #Trumpshutdown must not continue. In addition to 800k federal workers potentially missing their next paycheck, millions of Americans including poor children, families, seniors, veterans, and persons with disabilities may soon be faced with irreparable harm.
